lead_paragraph: KLION--Janet Tucker, died April 18, 2016 at her home in Greenwich, Connecticut, at the age of 88, surrounded by her loving family. Born in New Rochelle, New York, on January 15, 1928 to Grace and Ralph Tucker, she graduated from New Rochelle High School in 1945, and Smith College in 1949. In 1951, Janet wed Stanley Ring Klion, to whom she was married for 43 years until his death in 1994. Together they raised three daughters in suburban Philadelphia, Boston, and New York. A lifetime bibliophile, Janet worked in publishing, libraries and community bookstores. Janet provided her infamous "Klion Klips" to all. An accomplished artist, she accompanied the 1992 US Paralympic Team to Barcelona as their photographer. She was an avid tennis player, earning the nickname "Ace." Janet was active in Greenwich Library's Oral History Project, conducting dozens of interviews of community members and World War II veterans. She was a member of the Greenwich Daffodil Society, Holly Hill Tones, Smith College Alumnae Club, and Stamford Photography Club, where she met her partner of twenty years, Bob Weinberg. Janet was predeceased by her husband Stanley and brother Ralph Tucker, Jr. Survived by daughters Cathy, Emily, and Jenny Klion; sons-in-law Tom Plotz and George Brooks; grandchildren David, Joanna, Laelena, Toby, Misha, and Eve; and her partner Bob. Janet was a dear friend who believed in performing random acts of kindness She believed in the generosity of performing random acts of kindness and creating peace among family, friends, and throughout the world. Donations to Firstbooks.org. 1/3
